poem:
Title: To Valencia, My Inebriate Muse

Valencia, your wine unkissed, unknown,
In olden school days when we were lone.
Now, the taste, a memory, caught in time,
Never sighed upon my lips, nor paired with dine.
Ruminations in a repeating restaurant scene,
Your vine - an under-the-radar dream.
February's folly left us sober,
But, Valencia, our love is far from over.
